ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: Homework took a weekend, readings usually took about a day....

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: A good introduction into the subject. A lot of the derivations were very helpful to understand where the formulas originated from. I would of liked to spend a little less of the class discussing papers and a little more covering the fundamentals of martingales.

Strengths: Prof. Ma's ability to dynamically answer questions; the lectures were always really clear and well-prepared; Prof. Ma lectured on both "classical" survival techniques but also incorporated "hot topics" and recent work in the field; all major theory was explained well, class was a lot of fun!Weaknesses: I didn't love the textbook. Lectures were great, but textbook was difficult to read/study.
The course was great and Prof. Ma did a great job covering a variety of classical and current topics in Survival Analysis

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Shuangge Ma  A great instructor that cares about his students and is always willing to help! Really knowledgeable in the material.

Instructor: Shuangge Ma  Prof. Ma is amazing; he genuinely cares if the class understands the material. He encouraged thoughtful questions and always answered with care. I appreciated his commitment to dynamic learning -- when the class was particularly interested/confused by something, we slowed down and enjoyed/figured out the material.Prof. Ma has taught me so much. He is my favorite professor at Yale. He is a wonderful teacher and works very hard to teach well.
Instructor: Shuangge Ma  Prof. Ma is a great instructor and I had a great time learning from him. Thanks a lot!!

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend it to all other student
A great course for those interested in getting the underlying theory of survival analysis.
Great course for Biostats masters and PhD students.
